snippet: Most people don’t know the difference between health savings accounts and flexible-spending arrangements.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column describes differences between two types of health spending plans that people often confuse: flexible-spending arrangements, which allows a person put aside pre-tax dollars for medical expenses, and health savings accounts, which work in tandem with high-deductible health plans.
lead_paragraph: Most people don’t know the difference between health savings accounts and flexible-spending arrangements.

headline.main: The Alphabet Soup of Health Spending Plans
headline.print_headline: The Alphabet Soup of Health Spending Plans

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
